name: Orange-headed Thrush
description: Despite its Czech name, not only its head but also its chest and belly are orange. Males are gray-blue above, while females are more brownish.
spread_note: Fragmented areas of southern and southeastern Asia, from India to Java
food_note: Insects, worms, and other invertebrates, also fruits
proportions: Body length 16 cm, tail length 7.5–8 cm, weight 47–60 g
reproduction: The female lays 3–5 eggs, incubating for 13–14 days.
attractions: Shy and quiet, it lives mostly alone or in pairs, sometimes joining small mixed flocks.
breeding: The first pair arrived in 1999, with the first chick successfully raised in 2001.
